properties.name: Barley's Taproom and Pizzeria
properties.description: Posted by Apetty3200 E Jackson Ave, Knoxville, TNThis place is your average Friday night hang out, or maybe just mine. The food is excellent. The beer selection is quite large, and they always have a band playing. My band played there a few months back. Many of the bands that play here are guys that I know or play music with. They also have pool and darts upstairs.

properties.name: Bijou Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Apetty3 Knoxville, TNRight down the street from the Tennessee Theatre, this place puts up some pretty solid competition. The Bijou also brings in all kinds of different music, it is know for being a little more laid back then the Tennessee Theatre, who sometimes does not allow dancing. It is also cheaper for tickets at the Bijou. Son Volt is the next big act coming around here, I attached a picture of them.

properties.name: Civic Colesium
properties.description: Posted by Apetty3knoxville, TN 37915Also, another large music venue in Knoxville, the colisium also has many other sporting events such as hokey and ice skating. Recently Allison Krauss and Robert Plant played a concert there that was sold out for weeks before the show. I remember seeing The Allman Brothers Band there when I was little and thinking that the colisium was the coolest place.

properties.name: Historic Laurel Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Apetty3 This theatre is a really neat place to see a show. It is a very small theatre, which gives it a really intimate setting. I got to see Chris Thile here for only ten bucks about a year back, it was a really neat show.

properties.name: Historic Laurel Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Apetty3 This theatre has a vast array of musical acts as well as local plays and musicals. It is a very small venue, which makes seing shows much more intimate. I got to see my favorite mandolin player here for only ten bucks.

properties.name: Mama Jan's Coffee Shop and Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Apetty3  37 Market Sq, Knoxville, TNThis little shop is a new addition to Market Square. Located right next to Gus\'s deli, Mama Jans has music almost every night of the week. These are mostly local artist who just play for the fun of playing. My band plays here at least twice a month. Also, Ganasita, a local jamband in town, plays there once or twice a month as well. If your walking around Market Square and you hear music coming out of that little place, I recommend you stick your head in. My band will be playing here May 1, after Umphrey\'s McGee plays sundown. I attached a picture of me playing at mama jans.

properties.name: Preservation Pub
properties.description: Posted by Apetty328 Market Sq, Knoxville, TNThis is one of the coolest places to see a band it town due to the atmosphere. This place is always full of musicians whethter they are playing or not. I attached a picture of my favorite guitarist in town Micheal Seal. If you look close you will notice Jeff Coffin from the flecktones playing along with the band. Sometimes some really famous people can sneak into this bar. Mike Seal plays there at least once a week with many different bands and many different types of music. Shows here usually cost five bucks or so in a weekend, but definitely worth the cash if you catch the right band.

properties.name: Stir Fry Cafe  (Turkey Creek)
properties.description: Posted by Apetty3 11001 Parkside Dr. Knoxville, TNThis is where my band plays a lot of its gigs. Stir Fry has many different acts who play weekly. They range from jazz to bluegrass. Wednesday May, 7 Adam Petty and the SamKeeney string band will be playing(My band), we always make sure the crowd has just as much fun as we do.

properties.name: Tennessee Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Apetty3 604 S. Gay St., Knoxville, TN

properties.name: The Shed
properties.description: Posted by Apetty31820 W Lamar Alexander Pky, Maryville, TNLocated next to the Harley shop in Maryville, this is my favorite place to see a show around town. This is mainly due to the fact that it is an outdoor venue. It is under a pavilion, so even if it rains the band can still play. My favorite show that I\'ve seen there was the Derek Trucks Band. Tickets are never more than around ten dollars. They also have cheap beer and cheap food.

properties.name: The Valarium
properties.description: Posted by Apetty31213 western avenue knoxville tenneseeKnoxville\'s newest music venue. This place is getting most of the shows Blue Cat\'s was before it closed down. Valarium is much bigger than Blue Cat\'s and the sound quality is much better also. The last band I saw there was Govt. Mule, who played a show that could rip your face off.
